audio_description: Hi guys, welcome back to our channel, Sauté at Site. Today, we’re going to make the famous Talassery Chicken Biryani. This is an easy one-pot recipe without the hassle of layering or extra steps. So let's get started! First, we’ll prepare the biryani masala using common household spices.

audio_description: I’ve taken 1½ tsp fennel seeds, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 2 pieces of star anise, 1 cinnamon stick, 8–10 peppercorns, 4 cloves, and 4 green cardamoms. I’ll add them to a pan and dry roast until aromatic.

audio_description: The masala is now fragrant. I’ll let it cool and grind it into a fine powder. Next, we pre-cook the rice. I’ve taken water in a deep vessel and added 1 tbsp ghee along with whole spices — cardamom, cloves, pepper, star anise, cinnamon,

audio_description: Bring the water to a boil before adding the rice for best results. I’ve taken 2 cups of Jeerakasala rice, also called Kaima rice — traditionally used for Talassery biryani. If you don’t have it, you can use basmati rice, but soak it for 30 minutes. I’ve also taken 1 kg chicken, marinated with ¾ tsp turmeric, salt, lemon juice, and 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste.

audio_description: Stir the rice well. Cook until it’s al dente — about 75% done. It shouldn’t take more than 10–12 minutes. This is the perfect texture. Turn off the heat, strain the rice using a colander,

audio_description: and rinse it with cold water so the grains don’t stick together. Now, heat a pan with a mix of ghee and oil. It’s time to fry onions. I’ve taken 3 large onions, thinly sliced.
